page.title: 13Rogart - Lifestyle
page.content: Two hundred years ago, Rogart Hotel was a croft house. Next, it became the Post Office. For the last number of years it has been an hotel. The Maclennan family, three brothers and a sister, own it. Mr Charles Angus is their manager and he supervises the daily running of the hotel. In the summer-time, visitors from all parts of the world, come to stay in the small hotel. For the remainder of the year it is a public house and restaurant. The ever open hotel supplies meals, bar lunches, coffee, tea, non-alcoholic drinks, sweets,crisps and alcoholic drinks. Whisky is the most popular drink and fish and chips are the most popular item on the menu. Games played in the hotel are pool, darts, dominoes and cards. There is a video machine too.
